document.docAuthor: Motamedinia, Behnam, Skevington, Jeffrey H. & Kelso, Scott
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

bibRefCitation.author: Kozanek, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kozanek, M. (1992) Contribution to the pipunculid fauna of Mongolia (Diptera: Pipunculidae). Akitu, Kyoto Entomological Society, New Series, 131, 1 - 16.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: This species can be recognized by the shape of surstyli in lateral view; both bean-shaped ( Fig. 33D–E ); epandrium wider than long in dorsal view ( Fig. 33A ); coiled ejaculatory ducts ( Fig. 33D–E ); gonopods equal in height ( Fig. 33B ); rounded hypandrium with distinct hypandrial apodeme in ventral view ( Fig. 33B ). This species is closely related to
T. nodosa and T. hamounensis
sp. nov .
See the diagnosis notes under
T. nodosa
and
T. hamounensis
sp. nov .
for more details.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 33. Male genitalia of
Tomosvaryella pruinosa
(CNC470682, CNC) A) dorsal view, B) ventral view, C) ejaculatory apodeme, D, E) lateral view.

Distribution: Iran , Israel , Mongolia , United Arab Emirates ( Kozánek, 1992 , Skevington 2020 ) ( Fig. 62 ).

Note: Based on DNA barcodes,
T. pruinosa
is genetically closest to
T. urdaensis
, differing by 0.6% (pairwise divergence) (Supplementary Table 1 ).
